question:
you have seen an advertisement in an Australian magazine for someone to live with a family for six months and look after their six year old child. 
write a letter to the parents. in your letter 
explain why you would like the job
give details of why you would be suitable person to employ. 
say how you would spend your free time while you are in Australia
text: I would like to apply for the job adveristied in the 27th issue of "Mother and child" magazine. I know you are trying to find a short term live in care- taker for your six years old child.

I find myself very interested in having this positive experience with your family. My previous employees recommendations and my studies are suitable for this opening, in addition to Australia is my father's home country.
I belive that taking care of children is the most natural thing for me. I was the older child, I have got four brothers and only one sister. All of my life I helped my parents in taking care of them.

Currently, I am taking on line courses in my community college for Early childhood studies, which made me realize how passionate I am towards children. Also, I am trying to save some money for my next semster.

If I got accepted, in my spare time I would like to meet more of my father's family members. They never came to see us back in the United states because of the pricey air tickets. Australia is a beautiful country which makes me excited to discover its local sites.
Please let me know about your decesion as soon as possible.

error_list.error_des: The word adveristied is not in our dictionary. If you’re sure this spelling is correct, you can add it to your personal dictionary to prevent future alerts.
It appears that the word child may be a proper noun in this context. Consider capitalizing the word.
It appears that live in is missing a hyphen. Consider adding the hyphen(s).
The word care taker seems to be miswritten. Consider replacing it.
It appears that the word employees should use the genitive case. Consider changing the noun.

It appears that the singular verb is does not agree with the plural compound subject My previous employees recommendations and my studies are suitable for this opening, in addition to Australia. Consider changing the verb to the plural form.
The word belive doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The word belive doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The word on line seems to be miswritten. Consider replacing it.
